channel.title: OSRS Music pack
channel.description:
Hello,
I need help with getting all of osrs's music pack, those nostlagic and calming ambient sounds.. I tried finding some but i only found seperate ones, Is there a way to rip the whole music pack from osrs into .mp3 format?
I just need them for me to hear them while studying and nothing else, I'd really appreciate your help :)
Thanks!

item.title: OSRS Music pack
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:9, topic:547593”][quote author=naseem142 link=topic=666501.msg4456189#msg4456189 date=1415045917]

I don’t think they use the synthesizer anymore
[/quote]Some of the tracks still are a bit off though, so I guess they still do?

[hr]

Side note:
[img http://puu.sh/cBQW8/26533454e2.png[/img]
:DD

What do you mean?

These tracks do not sound exactly like how they do in-game, proving the game probably using a synthesizer to make the song sound different.

Atleast, I think thats what it means. I’ve been out of this scene for 2 months lol.[/quote]

Yeah noticed that too, the pitch is a little different

Read full topic

These tracks do not sound exactly like how they do in-game, proving the game probably using a synthesizer to make the song sound different.

Atleast, I think thats what it means. I’ve been out of this scene for 2 months lol.

item.title: OSRS Music pack
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“Whackatre, post:4, topic:547593”][quote author=naseem142 link=topic=666501.msg4456115#msg4456115 date=1415003020]

well i don’t know about osrs specifically but afaik the sound files in the older clients are all in midi format and are packed in the cache. you don’t “play” midi files – they’re just notation on what notes to play. you’d want to find a good midi synth and hence “convert” them into mp3 fmt.

i don’t have a cache extractor atm but i believe ^ has rs_music.zip. unfortunately i don’t have it right now, sorry.

Ok, i see… I think i’ll try to fiddle through old releases maybe i can find something if the links aren’t broken. Either way further help would be nice.

EDIT: By osrs i meant oldschool music if you misunderstood.
[/quote]

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/20717597/rs_music.zip[/quote]

Amazing, Thanks a lot man. They seem to play just fine. Unless when i want to burn them on dvd to use them on my old LG speakers i’ll have to convert them.

Where did you find them though? just wondering

Read full topic

well i don’t know about osrs specifically but afaik the sound files in the older clients are all in midi format and are packed in the cache. you don’t “play” midi files – they’re just notation on what notes to play. you’d want to find a good midi synth and hence “convert” them into mp3 fmt.

i don’t have a cache extractor atm but i believe ^ has rs_music.zip. unfortunately i don’t have it right now, sorry.
[/quote]

Ok, i see… I think i’ll try to fiddle through old releases maybe i can find something if the links aren’t broken. Either way further help would be nice.

EDIT: By osrs i meant oldschool music if you misunderstood.[/quote]

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/20717597/rs_music.zip

Read full topic
